todos.title: Six Critical Questions
todos.body: Why do we exist, how do we behave, what do we do, how will we succeed, what is most important right now, who must do what?

todos.title: Vulnerability Based Trust
todos.body: Team members are comfortable being transparent, honest, and naked with each other.  Leader must go first.

todos.title: Healthy Organization
todos.body: Minimal politics, minimal confusion, high morale, high productivity, low turnover.

todos.title: Behavioral Trust
todos.body: Knowing how a person will behave in a particular situation.

todos.title: Smart Organization
todos.body: Focuses on strategy, marketing, finance, and technology.

todos.title: Hire for Fit
todos.body: Your interview process should be designed to make sure prospects are a good cultural fit.  If you have an informal environment, ask the interviewee to change out his sweat pants for khaki shorts during the meeting and see how they react.

todos.title: Strategic Durability
todos.body: When barriers to entry are low and innovation is high, strategy needs to be reviewed and revised more frequently.

todos.title: Profiling
todos.body: Using metrics like Myers-Briggs Type Indicator to determine a persons type and how they interact with other types.

todos.title: Rumors
todos.body: The best way to make sure information gets through and organization is to spread rumors about it (versus formally announcing).  Information should be cascaded face to face, not through e-mails.

todos.title: Mining For Conflict
todos.body: Leaders that sense there is conflict should try to bring it out.  Leaders should encourage conflict as long as it is done in a constructive manner.  People don't have to like the decision of the conflict but they must understand it and support it for the greater good.

todos.title: Accidental Values
todos.body: Leaders need to watch out for accidental values that develop (such as just hiring white males).

todos.title: Value Check
todos.body: Is you organization more committed to this value than 99 percent of other companies in the industry?

todos.title: Simplify Values
todos.body: If everything is important then nothing is important.

todos.title: Chief Reminding Officer
todos.body: Great leaders are tasked with setting the direction of the organization and then reminding people of that direction on a daily basis.  Repetition is key to learning.  The message should come from different channels.

todos.title: Firing
todos.body: Firing someone is not necessarily the sign of accountability but is often the last act of cowardice for a leader who doesn't know how or isn't willing to hold people accountable.  People should quit because they know they can't be held accountable for the team's goals.

todos.title: Conflict
todos.body: Conflict is healthy in organizations as long as it is done constructively and is not mean spirited.  People should not be singled out.  Fear of conflict (meandering) is un-healthy.  People from different cultures respond to conflict differently.

todos.title: Conflict v. Accountability
todos.body: Conflict is about issues and ideas, accountability is about performance and behavior.
